description.narrative:
In 2014. Agriterra conducted a company assessment of Meru Central Coffee Co-operative Union (MCCCU), leading to a partnership and a first action plan supported by Agriterra in 2015. MCCCU united with Meru North Farmers Co-operative Union and the Coffee estates to jointly manage Meru County Coffee Millers Co-operative Union (MCCMCU), through a mill they have leased from Kenya Planters Co-operative Union (KPCU). In order to improve effectiveness of Agriterra’s support, it was decided to consider MCCMCU as a different client of Agriterra, and therefore a company assessment was planned. This assessment was conducted in October 2015.The team concluded:That there is a business case to work on together between Agriterra and MCCMCU. The case will be to develop a strategy beyond 2018 that has a bankable business plan where marketing of coffee will be the integral activity for MCCMCU. The mission team advises Agriterra to start a partnership with MCCMCU focusing on the 2 main objectives: (1) Strategic business plan beyond 2018 and (2) Strengthening People & Organization Under project of MCCCU, a marketing plan was developed for MCCMCU. This will be an important framework for action plan 2016.
The action plan will focus on improved coffee processing and marketing. MCCMCU has identified the following five objectives and strategies to reach these: 1. To reach out to the main specialty coffee importers worldwide and establish the first contacts with them: Send introduction emails/ visit international trade fairs/ Invite importers and roasters to visit MCCMCU 2. To increase Meru’s visibility as a specialty coffee supplier in the worldParticipate in international trade fairs/develop a website 3. To ensure that coffees fit with the specific quality needs and requirements of future customers Send coffee samples with standardized labels, continuous follow up and communication4. To ensure solid supply of parchment coffee from members to MCCMCUMember mobilization meetings5. To fetch good prices for the producers supplying to MCCMCU Promote quality production to being able to pay to sell the coffee with quality premiums
Improved coffee processing and marketing.
